newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE 1996/97 (AUG/JULY) FUTURES VOLUME SETS RECORD.
newsitem.headline: WCE 1996/97 (AUG/JULY) FUTURES VOLUME SETS RECORD.

text.p: Volume of trade in futures contracts on the Winnipeg Commodity Exchange in crop year 1996/97 (Aug/July) set a record at 2,059,196 contracts traded, a WCE statement said.
Volume of trade in 1995/96 reached 1,848,927 contracts.
Increased volume in canola, western barley and feed wheat propelled the WCE past the two million mark, it said.
Canola volume was 10.7 percent higher, western barley volume was up 25.9 percent and feed wheat was up 20.4 percent.
Volume in those contracts in July, however, was lower than July of the previous year.
Canola volume was 80,867 contracts, down 40.4 percent from July 1996 which posted 135,652 contracts traded, the WCE said.
Open interest as of July 31 stood at 32,149 contracts, down 26.3 percent versus July 31, 1996 when it was 43,624.
Western barley volume was 15,615 contracts, down 53.9 percent from July 1996 which saw 33,908 contracts traded.
Open interest as of July 31 was 10,256 contracts, down 24.9 percent versus July 31, 1996 when it was 13,659.
Feed wheat volume was 12,934 contracts, down 13.2 percent from July 1996's 14,896 contracts. Open interest as of July 31 was 10,740, up 18.3 percent compared to 9,081.
